name: 莊惠鈞
objective: Pragmatics, a subset of linguistics concerned with implied meanings (explicature and implicature based on context), examines language as a system of communication. This course emphasizes how language users' assumptions and inferences shape interpretation and expression, particularly within the context of English language usage. Its primary aim is to elucidate the cognitive mechanisms involved in making such assumptions and inferences, equipping students with practical skills to navigate and use English effectively. The course offers valuable insights for students seeking to (a) enhance their proficiency in English language communication and (b) pursue interdisciplinary research within the broader domain of cognitive science.
